questions.question: A 2 kg ball is dropped from 10 m. If 40 J is lost to air resistance, what is its speed just before hitting the ground? (g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: Initial PE = mgh = 2×10×10 = 200 J. Energy after loss = 200 - 40 = 160 J. KE = ½mv² = 160 → 0.5×2×v² = 160 → v² = 160 → v = √160 = 12.65 ≈ 14 m/s (closest)

questions.question: A rollercoaster car (600 kg) starts at 25 m height. If 15% of energy is lost to friction by the bottom, what is its speed at the bottom? (g = 10 m/s²)
A 5 kg object is lifted at constant speed through 4 m. How much work is done against gravity? (g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: Work against gravity = mgh = 5×10×4 = 200 J. Constant speed means force equals weight.

questions.question: A car's brakes convert 80,000 J of kinetic energy to heat. If the car's mass is 1,000 kg, what was its initial speed?
A pendulum bob loses 20% of its energy to air resistance each swing. If it starts with 50 J, how much energy remains after 2 complete swings?
questions.explanation: 1st swing: 50 × 0.8 = 40 J. 2nd swing: 40 × 0.8 = 32 J.

questions.question: A box slides 10 m on a rough floor. Friction does -500 J of work. What was the friction force?
questions.explanation: W = Fd → -500 = F × 10 → F = -50 N (magnitude 50 N)

questions.question: A rollercoaster car has 120,000 J at the top of a 30 m hill. At 15 m height, it has 90,000 J. How much energy was lost to friction?
questions.explanation: At 15 m, expected PE = ½ of initial PE = 60,000 J. But total energy is 90,000 J. Loss = initial - current = 120,000 - 90,000 = 30,000 J

questions.question: A spring launches a 0.2 kg ball vertically to 8 m height. How much energy was stored in the spring? (g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: All spring energy converts to PE: mgh = 0.2×10×8 = 16 J

questions.question: A 60 kg person runs up stairs, gaining 1,800 J of PE in 3 seconds. What is their power output?
questions.explanation: Power = Energy/time = 1,800 J / 3 s = 600 W

questions.question: Two cars have the same kinetic energy. Car A has twice the mass of Car B. How do their speeds compare?
options: Car B is twice as fast
Car A is twice as fast
questions.explanation: KE = ½mv². If m_A = 2m_B and KE same: ½(2m)v_A² = ½mv_B² → v_B² = 2v_A² → v_B = √2 v_A

questions.question: A book falls from a shelf, losing 5 J to air resistance. If it hits with 15 J of KE, from what height did it fall? (mass = 0.5 kg, g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: Initial PE = mgh = final KE + losses = 15 + 5 = 20 J. 0.5×10×h = 20 → h = 4 m

questions.question: A bungee jumper falls, then bounces back up. Select all true statements:
options: PE converts to KE during fall
KE converts to PE during rise
Maximum KE is at the top
Maximum PE is at the bottom
questions.explanation: A,B: Energy transforms between PE and KE. D: Real systems have energy losses. C: False due to losses. E,F: False - max KE at bottom, max PE at top.

questions.question: A wind turbine converts 25% of wind's KE to electricity. If wind has 40,000 J/s passing through, what is the turbine's power output?
questions.explanation: Power output = 25% of input = 0.25 × 40,000 W = 10,000 W

questions.question: A car (800 kg) slows from 20 m/s to 10 m/s. How much kinetic energy was lost?
A hydroelectric dam: Water falls 50 m at 200 kg/s. What is maximum possible power? (g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: Power = energy/time = (mgh)/t = (200×10×50)/1 = 100,000 W = 100 kW

questions.question: A skateboarder coasts down a hill, then up another. Select energy transformations occurring:
options: Comes to same height as start
questions.explanation: A,B: Energy transforms. C: Friction losses. D: False - energy decreases. E: False - max speed at bottom. F: False - lower due to friction.

questions.question: A pump lifts 100 kg of water 5 m in 4 seconds. What is its power output? (g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: Work = mgh = 100×10×5 = 5,000 J. Power = Work/time = 5,000/4 = 1,250 W

questions.question: An object's KE increases from 100 J to 400 J. By what factor did its speed increase?
questions.explanation: KE ∝ v². KE increased 4×, so v increased √4 = 2 times.

questions.question: A rollercoaster's first hill is 40 m, second hill is 25 m. If no energy loss, what fraction of first hill's speed at second hill's top?
questions.explanation: At second hill top: PE = mg×25. From first hill: total energy = mg×40. So KE = mg×(40-25) = mg×15. Speed ratio = √(KE ratio) = √(15/40)

questions.question: A battery stores 18,000 J. It runs a 60 W light bulb. How long until battery is empty?
questions.explanation: Time = Energy/Power = 18,000 J / 60 W = 300 s = 5 minutes

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You understand energy transformations and real-world applications!
scoreMessages.70: Good work! Review energy losses and proportional reasoning (KE ∝ v²).
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing! Focus on energy conservation with losses.
scoreMessages.0: Review basic energy formulas and try energy transformation problems.
